STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ELIZABETH HERTEL
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
November 18, 2021
Pamela Cornell-Allen
Ozone House Youth Shelter
1600N. Huron River Dr.
Ypsilanti, MI 48197
RE: License #: CI810402260
Ozone House Youth Shelter
1600N. Huron River Dr.
Ypsilanti, MI 48197
Dear Ms. Cornell-Allen:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
10/14/21. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also violations
of the MISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date
of this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 For repeat violation, identify why the previous CAP was unsuccessful.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 552-3662.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Kari Muntean, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
22 Center Street
Ypsilanti, MI 48198
(734) 395-0920
enclosure
2

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.4113 Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and shall include documentation of all of the following
information prior to employment or at the time specified in this
rule:
(b)A true copy of verification of education from an accredited
college or university where minimum education requirements
are specified by rule.
(c) Verification of high school diploma or GED when
specified by rule.
(e) Three dated references which are obtained prior to
employment from persons unrelated to the employee and which
are less than 12 months old.
(f) A record of any convictions other than minor traffic
violations from either of the following entities:
(i) Directly from the Michigan state police or the
equivalent state law enforcement agency, Canadian province, or
other country where the person usually resides or has resided in
the previous 5 years.
(ii) From an entity accessing either Michigan state police
records or equivalent state, Canadian provincial, or other
country law enforcement agency where the person usually
resides or has resided in the previous 5 years.
(i) Documentation from the Michigan department of human
services, the equivalent state or Canadian provincial agency, or
equivalent agency in the country where the person usually
resides, that the person has not been determined to be a
perpetrator of child abuse or child neglect. The documentation
shall be completed not more than 30 days prior to the start of
employment and every 12 months thereafter.
(j) A written evaluation of the employee's performance within
30 days of the completion of the probationary period or within
180 days, whichever is less, and a written evaluation of the
employee’s performance annually thereafter.
1

(b) and (c) Two of 13 new employee files contained documentation of education that
was obtained after hire.
(e) One of 13 new employee files reviewed contained only two references.
(f) Three of 13 new employee files reviewed contained criminal clearances
completed after hire. One of those three was for the required out of state clearance.
(i) Four of 13 new employee files reviewed were found to have central registry
clearances that were completed after hire (3) or were missing from the file (1).
(j) Two of nine applicable employee files reviewed were found to have late
performance evaluations.
R 400.4114 Tuberculosis screening for employees and volunteers.
The licensee shall document, prior to employment, that each
employee and volunteer who has contact with residents 4 or
more hours per week for more than 2 consecutive weeks is free
from communicable tuberculosis. Freedom from communicable
tuberculosis shall be verified within the 1-year period before
employment and shall be verified every 1 year after the last
verification or prior to the expiration of the current verification.
Three of three existing employees were found to have late annual tuberculosis
screens, and two of 13 new employees were found to be missing tuberculosis
screens.
R 400.4128 Initial staff orientation and ongoing staff training.
(3) The licensee shall document that each staff person whose
function is covered by these rules has participated in a minimum
of 50 clock hours of planned training within the first year of
employment and a minimum of 25 clock hours of training
annually thereafter related to the employee’s job function. At
least 16 of the 50 hours provided in the first year shall be
orientation provided prior to the assumption of duties.
10 of 13 new employee files did not contain documentation of at least 16 hours of
orientation prior to the assumption of duties. Additionally, one of three existing
employees was missing documentation of 25 hours of annual training.
2

R 400.4146 Immunizations.
(2) If documentation of immunizations is unavailable,
immunizations shall begin within 30 calendar days of admission,
unless a statement from a physician indicating that
immunizations are contraindicated is included in the resident’s
record.
Two of two applicable current resident files did not contain documentation of
immunizations.
R 400.4147 Dental Care.
(2) A dental examination within 12 months prior to admission
shall be documented or there shall be an examination not later
than 90 calendar days following admission.
One applicable current resident file did not have a dental examination.
R 400.4150 Incident reporting.
(1) Any incident resulting in serious injury of a resident or illness
requiring inpatient hospitalization, shall be reported to the
parent/ legal guardian, responsible referring agency, and the
licensing authority as soon as possible, but not more than 24
hours after the incident.
(3) If an institution determines that a youth is absent without
legal permission, then the institution shall immediately report the
information to law enforcement, the parent/legal guardian or
next of kin, the licensing authority, and the referring agency.
(1) During a review of incident reports, it was noted that one AWOL youth was sent
to the hospital and kept overnight, and this was not reported to DCWL (09/25/21).
(3) There were two incident reports reviewed and it was found that the facility had
two AWOLs that were not reported to DCWL (04/21/21 and 09/25/21).
3

R 400.4152 Initial documentation.
At the time of admission, all of the following shall be in the
resident's case record:
(a) Name, address, birth date, sex, gender, race, height, weight,
hair color, eye color, identifying marks, religious preference, and
school status.
(c) A brief description of the resident's preparation for placement
and general physical and emotional state at the time of
admission.
(g) Authorization to provide medical, dental, and surgical care
and treatment as provided in section 14 a (1), (2), and (3) of
1973 PA 116, MCL 722.124a.
(i) Documentation that the grievance policy was provided as
required in R 400.4132.
(a) Two of three current resident files were found to be missing required information
such as, identifying marks or religion. REPEAT VIOLATION, Renewal Report
dated 10/01/20 and corresponding CAP dated 09/30/20. The facility must
identify why the previous CAP as unsuccessful.
(c) Two of three current resident files were found to be missing documentation of the
resident's preparation for placement and general physical and emotional state at the
time of admission.
(g) Three of three current resident files did not have authorization for dental care.
Additionally, separate forms are used by the facility for the short term and long-term
programs, therefore, they must ensure that new authorizations are obtained when a
youth moves to the long-term program.
(i) Three of three current resident files did not have documentation that the grievance
policy was provided to the youth at the time of admission.
R 400.4153 Shelter care and detention institutions; preliminary service
plans.
Within 7 calendar days of admission, a plan shall be developed
for each resident. The plan shall include all of the following:
(a) The reason for care.
(b) An assessment of the resident’s immediate and
specific needs.
(c) The specific services to be provided by the institution.
(d) Other resources to meet the resident’s needs.
Three of three current resident files did not have a completed preliminary service
plan.
4

R 400.4154 Shelter care and detention institutions; service plans.
(1) Within 30 calendar days after admission and every 15
calendar days thereafter, an institution shall complete a written
service plan. The service plan shall include all of the following:
(a) The reason for continued care.
(b) Evaluation of service needs.
(c) Ongoing service needs.
(d) How service needs will be met.
(e) Unmet service needs and the reasons those needs
are unmet.
Two of two applicable current resident files did not have 30-day service plans. One
file contained a plan, but it was completed 10 days late and did not address all of the
requirements of the rule.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The
facility does not service youth in foster care, therefor MISEP does not apply.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract/Policy violation. Please
note that there are additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is not contracted with MDHHS for care of youth
in foster care, therefore; there are no contract or policy requirements.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
R 166
The worker should have the discharge plan ready for afterhours discharges so that
the full report is reviewed with the youth, parent. There was more information on the
second discharge summary than the one reviewed by youth and parent in one of the
closed files.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
Consultation was provided related to AWOL and hospitalization reporting, and file
documentation.
5

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care or incidents of
substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing period.
The facility has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during this
licensing period.
The facility experienced significant turnover through the last year as well as some
unforeseen time off by the administrators. This appears to have negatively effected
the usual flow of the program as evidenced by the increased number of violations.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility
continue on their regular license.
November 16, 2021
________________________________________
Kari Muntean Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
November 17, 2021

Claudia Triestram Date
Area Manager
